meanings.definition: Something new created as a result of study and experiment.
examples: Through many years of thinking and experiments, Edison came up with many inventions.

meanings.definition: An official permission to have or do something.
examples: I have a license to drive a car.

images.description: A driver's license from the state of Virginia. A person's name and other information are shown on the license.
images.caption: A person needs to have a license to use a car or motorcycle.

meanings.definition: A machine for reproducing sounds by means of the vibration of a stylus or needle following a spiral groove on a revolving disc or cylinder.
examples: We listened to music using the old phonograph. My grandmother calls the phonograph a record player.

images.alt: A vinyl record on a record player.
images.description: A flat plastic disk with grooves in its surface. A plastic arm extends onto the grooves. A hole is in the center of the disk, allowing the disk to spin in a circle.
images.caption: You need a phonograph (or record player) to hear the sound stored on the vinyl record.

source.title: Black Vinyl Record On Vinyl Record Player
source.author: Wendy Wei

meanings.definition: A share of the value of a company which can be bought, sold, or traded as an investment.
examples: Most of her money is invested in stocks.

images.alt: Photo of a crowd of people around a stage.
images.description: A large number are shown, gathered around a stage.
images.caption: This audience looks ready to hear a debate!

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an organized system of making products.
examples: America's economy changed from agriculture to industry during the 1800s.

images.alt: Photo Of An Industrial Factory Emitting Smoke
images.description: A group of buildings with tall smoke stacks. Smoke is coming out of the smoke stacks.
images.caption: Industrial pollution is a problem that needs to be solved.

source.title: Photo Of An Industrial Factory Emitting Smoke
source.author: Pixabay

meanings.definition: To ask for forcefully; to order
examples: The protesters gathered to demand action on climate change.

images.alt: Photo of protesters and protest signs
images.description: Photo of protester holding sign. Sign says, 'Fight today for a Better Tomorrow.'
images.caption: People demand action on climate change.

meanings.definition: An effect on something, such as feeling, sense, or mind.
examples: Have you turned on a light today? You've already felt the influence of one of Edison's inventions!

meanings.definition: Forming, or at the basis of; main.
examples: The basic version of the car did not have extra things like air conditioning or power windows.

meanings.definition: To get or obtain something by paying money.
examples: When you purchase something, you are buying it.

images.alt: Photo of one person handing a credit card to another person
images.description: One person holds a credit card. Another person reaches for the credit card. The person reaching for the card holds a small black machine used to take credit card payments.
images.caption: A credit card is one way to purchase something. Cash is another way.

meanings.definition: To take out; to separate; to remove.
examples: Dentists use special tools to extract a tooth that is causing problems.
The simple version of the car does not have extra things like air conditioning or power windows.

meanings.definition: To get something by paying money.
examples: When you purchase something, you are buying it.

images.alt: Photo of one person handing a credit card to another person
images.description: One person holds a credit card. Another person reaches for the credit card. The person reaching for the card holds a small black machine used to take credit card payments.
images.caption: A credit card is one way to purchase something. Cash is another way.

meanings.definition: To take out or change location of.
examples: Dentists use special tools to remove a tooth that is causing problems.
The protesters desire action on climate change.

images.alt: Photo of protesters and protest signs
images.description: Photo of protester holding sign. Sign says, 'Fight today for a Better Tomorrow.'
images.caption: People demand action on climate change.

meanings.definition: An effect on something, such as feeling, sense, or mind.
examples: Have you turned on a light today? If yes, one of Edison's inventions has already made an impression on you!

meanings.definition: Forming, or at the basis of; main.
examples: The rudimentary version of the car did not have extra things like air conditioning or power windows.
When you buy something, you are procuring it.

images.alt: Photo of one person handing a credit card to another person
images.description: One person holds a credit card. Another person reaches for the credit card. The person reaching for the card holds a small black machine used to take credit card payments.
images.caption: A credit card is one way to procure something. Cash is another way.

meanings.definition: To take out, free, or remove.
examples: Dentists use special tools to extricate a tooth that is causing problems.
